claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A multi‐column table listing licensed influenza vaccines for the 2022–23 season, grouped by formulation type (standard‐dose egg‐based quadrivalent, cell culture–based, high‐dose egg‐based, MF59‐adjuvanted egg‐based, recombinant HA, live attenuated egg‐based), with columns for manufacturer, presentations (e.g., 0.5‐mL prefilled syringe, 5.0‐mL multidose vial), age indications, antigen content per dose (µg of HA per virus), route of administration (intramuscular or intranasal), and HA per dose in µg/mL where applicable. The table provides dosing and presentation details for different influenza vaccines but does not mention or provide data on mutations arising during egg‐ or cell culture production or any impact on vaccine effectiveness; it does not support the claim. Note: Image is clear for all vaccine specifications; no statements about production‐related mutations or effectiveness were visible.
